titleStmt.title: Eli Tartar et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5563

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Hon. Thomas. E. Bramlette!
Governor of the Commonwealth of Ky

We the undersigned citizens living in and near the Town of Harrison, Pulaski County State of Kentucky, and well aquainted with A. D. Taylor who kept a Tavern and sold spiritous liquors in said Town, know that said Taylor kept a good and orderly house and believe that the Judgement rendered against him at our late term of the Circuit Court held in the town of Somerset in September last ought to be set aside and the said Taylor relieved of said fine, as said Taylor thought he had the right to sell spiritous liquors under a Licence granted to J. R. McBeath who formerly occupied the location where the said Taylor did.
We also know that said Taylor did not sell any liquor after the License granted to J. R. McBeath and out ^expired^

Eli Tartar
Henry Norfleet
William Thomas
William Wood
Daniel Tartar
Ivy Tartan
J stogal
Crage Pennington
N tartar
J M Weddle
E. T. Barker
George Hail
C. J. Sievere
H. F McBeath
Simon Pennington
Thomas Price
S. Weddle
R Floid
M J Cain
Henry Gose
Perry Weddle
Jacob.F. Eades
John owen
John H Fry
H J Roberts
Jacob Tartar
